alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 25 at 10:13PM PST until December 27 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM T ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THURSDAY TO 9 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Abnormally high tides around 7 feet are expected each morning through Wednesday. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 12 feet are expected Thursday into Saturday. Local sets of 15 to 20 feet will be likely near Point Conception. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Wednesday afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM Thursday to 9 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. No significant damage is expected through Wednesday. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will occur each morning between 800 AM and 900 AM. Later on, large surf is expected Thursday through at least Saturday. During this time, there is the potential for surf up to 10 feet across west facing beaches of Los Angeles County. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.2 to 6.6 feet may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. This could require the issuance of a coastal flood advisory as we draw closer to the event.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
